channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here’s why some NBA teams show their games on TV for free, while others charge fans hundreds of dollars
item.description: NBA owners have very different ideas about the benefits of showing their teams’ games for free.

item.title: In Retirement, It's Time to Put Our Costs Under the Microscope
item.description: We discovered all sorts of things we are paying for that we don’t really need or use. But there’s one cost we’re not ready to face.

item.title: Stocks Wrap Up Volatile Week With Gains
item.description: Shares of Amazon and Intel help the S&P 500 recoup some losses from the prior session.

item.title: My boyfriend struggled to come up with a down payment when we bought our house. I have $50K in investments. Was I wrong to keep this to myself?
item.description: “I could have cashed out my investments to get us closer to a 20% down payment.”

item.title: ‘I have the father-in-law from hell’: He stole my late husband’s savings — and took ownership of our home. What can I do?
item.description: “Law enforcement says they can’t prove that he forged signatures, so no charges can be filed.”

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: Nvidia to Replace Intel in Dow Jones Industrial Average. Sherwin-Williams Also Joins.
item.description: The swap reflects their reversal of fortunes within the tech industry and would have been unthinkable a few years ago.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.15% This Week to 99.11
item.description: The WSJ Dollar index climbed Friday to post a slight gain for the week.

item.title: Nvidia to replace Intel in the Dow, underscoring downfall of an industry titan
item.description: Nvidia will replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, illustrating a changing of the guard in technology and the downfall of what was once an...

item.title: ‘I became very frugal’: My husband and I are 40. I have $200,000 in student debt, while he has $600,000 in retirement savings. Are we in trouble?
item.description: “Neither of us will have an inheritance and everything we have, we built together.”
